page.title: 12RELIGION IN CHIRNSIDE
page.content: Chirnside Parish Church is the only church being used for worship in the village. Before World War 1 there were 3 churches. The North Church is now being used as a community centre and the third church was demolished so that sheltered housing could be built. There is also a mission hall. Rev W P Graham has been minister for 17 years and preaches to an average congregation of 50. He is also minister to the churches at Bonkyl and Edrom which have fortnightly services. He is chaplain to the Knoll Hospital, Duns, and to Chirnside Primary School, which he visits twice a month. A Sunday School is held for children aged 5 to 12 years, with an evening group for older pupils. At the Sunday School Club, on Tuesdays, the activities include drama, games and visits.
